description: Demolition and replacement of roof, refurbishment and restoration of building including replacement windows and doors, to aid conversion of building to residential dwelling (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The works hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this consent.
REASON

To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun.

The development hereby permitted shall not be carried out except in complete accordance with the details shown on the submitted plans numbers: 03, 04,  05, 06, 07, 09, 201, 202, 203, 204, 205B, 206B,  207A, 208, 209, 210, 211, 0101, 0102, P966/03 Rev. B, Construction Methodology Statement dated June 2020, Design and Access Statement, Covering Letter dated March 2020, Structural Repairs - Ref: S82605/UXB/ANB/008, St Andrews Park Window Survey and Lime Wash Paint Details and shall thereafter be retained and maintained for as long as the development remains in existence, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority.
REASON

To ensure that the external appearance of the development is satisfactory and complies with policies DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to commencement of works, the roof shall be recorded up to a Level 1 recording as defined by Historic England's Understanding Historic Buildings: A Guide to Good Recording Practice Document (May 2016). The record shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Following approval copies of the document shall be deposited to the Local History Archive (Uxbridge Library) and the Greater London Historic Environment Record (GLHER).
REASON

To safeguard the special interest of the building and its setting in accordance with Policy HE1 of the Local Plan: Part One (2012), Policies DMHB 1 and 2 of the Local Plan: Part Two (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to commencement of works to demolish the existing roof structure, details in relation to the repair of the existing chimney stack and timber louvred structure shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include a full schedule of works and a methodology statement to repair the structures. Works shall be carried out in accordance to approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the building in accordance with DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to commencement of works a full schedule of repairs to the existing building including a methodology statement in relation to proposed works, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Works shall be carried out in accordance to approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the building in accordance with DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to commencement of relevant works, details of all new external windows shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include scaled drawings including joinery detail ideally at 1:1 or 1:5 in scale and where relevant manufacturer information, product type, code and colour. Works shall be carried out in accordance to approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the building in accordance with DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to installation, details of the external extract flues and vents shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Details shall include manufacturer information, the product type, code, material and colour. Works shall be carried out in accordance to approved details.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the building in accordance with DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

As approved, the rain water goods to be installed shall comprise of Cast iron beaded half round gutters (115mm) and cast iron round downpipe eared access pipes (75mm) supplied by gutter supplies and thereafter retained and maintained in situ unless otherwise agreed with the Local Planning Authority.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the building in accordance with DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.
Prior to installation a detailed scaled section of the Limecrete floor slab including product information shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
REASON
To safeguard the special interest of the building in accordance to Local Plan policies, HE1 (Part 1), DMHB 1 and 2 (Part 2) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

Prior to relevant works commencing, a sample panel in a discreet location of the paint finish shall be carried out on site for inspection by the Local Planning Authority. Request for inspection shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The works shall be carried out in strict accordance to the approved detail and thereafter retained and maintained in situ.
REASON

To safeguard the special interest of the building and its setting in accordance to Local Plan policies, HE1 (Part 1), DMHB 1 and 2 (Part 2) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

During works, if hidden historic features are revealed they would need to be retained in-situ. Works shall be halted to the relevant area of the site and/ or building and the Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately. Failure to do so may result in unauthorised works being carried out and an offence being committed.
REASON

To safeguard the special interest of the building and its setting in accordance with Policy HE1 of the Local Plan: Part One (2012), Policies DMHB 1 and 2 of the Local Plan: Part Two (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

All relevant fixings associated to the temporary supports for the external walls, chimney stack and timber louvred structure during consented works associated to the roof shall be fixed within mortar joints only.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the building in accordance with DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

The existing roof and ridge tiles shall be carefully removed by hand and stored on site for reuse. Only significantly deteriorated tiles shall be replaced with new Ashdowne, Ashurt plain clay roof tiles manufactured by Marley Eternit. The new tiles shall be carefully mixed in with the re-used existing roof tiles.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the building in accordance with DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

All roofing works shall be completed within 6 months following the demolition of the existing roof structure to ensure the retained built fabric of the building is safeguarded. Any damage or disturbance to the building in execution of the consented works shall be made goof to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority within 3 month of the works being completed.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the building in accordance with DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.
All re-pointing works shall match that of the existing pointing style. The mortar shall be of the same material composition, colour and texture.
REASON

To safeguard the special architectural and/or historic interest of the building in accordance with DMHB 1 and DMHB 2 of the Hillingdon Local Plan: Part Two - Development Management Policies (2020) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.
All soffits and eaves boards shall be constructed of timber.
REASON

To safeguard the special interest of the building and its setting in accordance to Local Plan policies, HE1 (Part 1), DMHB 1 and 2 (Part 2) and the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990.

The decision to GRANT Listed Building Consent has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to GRANT Listed Building Consent has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Unitary Development Plan Saved Policies (November 2012) as incorporated into the Hillingdon Local Plan (2012) set out below, including Supplementary Planning Guidance, and to all relevant material considerations, including The London Plan - The Spatial Development Strategy for London consolidated with alterations since 2011 (2016) and national guidance.

It would need to be noted by all with an interest in this Listed Building that this approval extends only to the works detailed as part of this application. In the event that the works cannot be implemented without a greater degree of alteration, the Local Planning Authority's Conservation/ Listed Building Officer would need to be informed to ascertain whether further Consent might be required.
site_name: CARPENTERS COTTAGE, FORMER RAF UXBRIDGE, ST ANDREWS PARK
